snippet: Michael Horn, the chief executive of Volkswagen Group of America, is expected to apologize for the company’s trickery before Congress on Thursday.
abstract: Volkswagen Group of America chief executive Michael Horn says he was aware of possible diesel emissions problem with vehicles in spring 2014, earlier than date acknowledged by management in United States; prepares to testify at congressional hearing.

byline.original: By DANIELLE IVORY and JACK EWING
byline.contributor: Melissa Eddy and Aaron M. Kessler contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Michael Horn, the chief executive of Volkswagen Group of America, is expected to apologize for the company’s trickery before Congress on Thursday.

headline.main: Volkswagen U.S. Chief Knew of Potential Emissions Problems in 2014
headline.print_headline: In U.S., VW Was Aware of ‘Possible’ Problem
